metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23218 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
The deprecated compatibility function svcunix_create in the sunrpc module of the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.34 copies its path argument on the stack without validating its length, which may result in a buffer overflow, potentially resulting in a denial of service or (if an application is not built with a stack protector enabled) arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23218` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.35-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.35-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.35-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Ubuntu has stack protector enabled since 2006, so this issue is only a denial of service.

criterions.comment: glibc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.35-0ubuntu1').
